creditline: The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books
medium: Pressure prints (relief) with screenprinting, stab-bound volume with tortoise-stitching
text:
Designed and produced by longtime partners and artist collaborators Dutes Miller and Stan Shellabarger, this unique artists' book presents an intimate portrait of the artists' personal and professional relationship. The book's imagery is essentially a multi faceted self portrait, addressing intimacy, proximity, and queerness. Informed by fragmented ephemera of older work, images of the artists' heads, entangled bodies, and handprints are layered and re layered atop one another, moving backward and forward through time, creating a cinematic experience. The book is non linear in its narrative construction, and the imagery repeats throughout. There is also a repetition of a text quotation from a Gertrude Stein novel, both at the beginning and end of the book: “Loving repeating in some is a going on always in them of earthly being, in some it is the way to completed understanding.” 

Commenting on the ideas behind the book series, Miller and Shellabarger explained: “Speaking both to common experiences of intimacy as well as the specifics of queer identities, we attempt to document the rhythms of relationships. The title of the series comes from Gertrude Stein’s novel The Making of the Americans. Stein’s discussion of the way in which life, history, and time is formed and understood is emblematic of our own relationship: Life is made of small, repeated gestures, and each repetition accumulating over time equals history. Our work tries to document the intimacy of these small and repetitive moments in a variety of ways.”
title: Untitled (Loving Repeating 3)
